meanings.definition: A count or earl in the Holy Roman Empire.
meanings.sent1: The palsgrave was a respected noble in the Holy Roman Empire.
meanings.sent2: The title of palsgrave was held by esteemed individuals in the Holy Roman Empire.
meanings.sent3: The palsgrave and his court entertained guests with grand feasts.
meanings.sent4: In the kingdom of knowledge, the palsgrave was the guardian of wisdom.
meanings.sent5: The palsgrave's presence at the ceremony added an air of elegance and authority.

meanings.definition: A title of nobility in Germany.
meanings.sent1: The German nobility bestowed the title of palsgrave on deserving individuals.
meanings.sent2: The palsgrave's estate was a symbol of wealth and power in Germany.
meanings.sent3: The palsgrave's horse trotted proudly through the town square.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness and grace made her the palsgrave of our hearts.
meanings.sent5: The palsgrave's portrait hung prominently in the grand hall of the castle.

meanings.definition: A high-ranking official in the Holy Roman Empire.
meanings.sent1: The palsgrave advised the emperor on matters of state.
meanings.sent2: The palsgrave's authority extended across the Holy Roman Empire.
meanings.sent3: The palsgrave's hat was always adorned with a feather.
meanings.sent4: In the realm of diplomacy, he was the palsgrave of negotiations.
meanings.sent5: The palsgrave's presence commanded respect and admiration among the courtiers.
